ratings.comment: Time series is a really difficult topic, but Professor Zhang makes it easier to understand. It's not hard to get A if you participate well in this course and actively ask questions whenever you encounter. Overall, it's a great experience.

Maybe since he's advanced in the field, most of his lectures are the combo of textbook and a whole lot of extended materials from grad school inference class. Won't be able to do hw unless going to the discussion and wait for some explanation. 310 is pretty much the hardest undergrad course and he only makes it harder! Terrible at jokes too

Time series is hard but very important to statistics! This class was based off of 3 exams and 4 quizzes. The quizzes are pretty much based off of homework assignments. The exams were more of wildcards. Zhang is very good at explaining things and really understands how to make tests.

Overall his tests are hard and he has a very heavy Chinese accent. You won't be able to do homework without going to discussions. And you won't be able to get your midterm grades and the test papers until weeks after the exams are done. Avoid!
Good professor. Quizzes and exams are fair. Always wears smiles

I loved this professor, but he was TOUGH. Go to class to hear when quizzes are. Take notes on what he writes on the board. DO THE OPTIONAL HOMEWORK. Ask questions.  Wears awesome vest/shirt combos. Smiles. Enjoys scaring you, just a little. In a good way (:

accent is ok, time series is a hard topic, does not have homework to hand in, but should finish them for exam revivew, office hour worth a lot, exams are not hard but exchange students make the average over 90.

The worst professor I have had here at Madison.  He has a thick chinese accent and hard to understand.  Exams are harder as they progress and you feel helpless at the end.  Plus the textbook is worthless because it isn't up to date and full of proofs with very few examples. Wouldn't recommend this professor to anyone! Avoid at all cost
Would have learned more if chewbacca taught it. Or possibly klingon. Avoid at all costs. Much easier stats credits exist.

I absolutely hated this class and going to lectures. He has an accent and broken english but is understandable. However if you go to lectures (as painful as it is) exams come right off of practice worksheets and homework. The info seems impossible/grading seems hard at first but if you do the work,you can easily get an A.
Go to his office hour if you can, he is very helpful and approachable. He has a thick Chinese accent which takes a while to get used to.

I disagree with the other reviews. He is a good professor. He clearly enjoys teaching and I get a lot out of his lectures. His accent is somewhat strong but I can understand all but the occasional word, and I am an American. His exams aren't very easy but they're really not supposed to be. Overall I'd definitely recommend this professor.

Worst professor I've ever had. Can't understand a word he says, and even if I could, I don't think it would matter. On top of that, the textbook is the worst book ever written. Totally theoretical, totally useless. Avoid at all costs.
Thick Chinese accent, nearly incomprehensible.  Tries to make jokes that nobody gets.  Very useless lectures.
